Guide to the perfect cheeseboard

2 JAN 2017 • 1 min read

One of our favorite things to do is have wine and a cheeseboard as a dinner alternative from time to time. One of the local restaurants in Worcester does a beautiful spread that we love to recreate.

  1. Have 2-4 types of cheeses. I prefer soft ones so we do about 2 soft cheeses (goat & brie for me) and then 2 firm cheeses (we enjoy a smoked gouda and cheddar).
  2. Add a few types of charcuterie. Prosciutto is our favorite and featured on all of our boards. The others we pick based on the selection at the market.
  3. Add fruit for color (and flavor!) I think the popping contrast of blueberries and strawberries are my favorite.
  4. Don’t forget the toppings! Hands down, fig jam makes our board half the time. Honey is also a great touch. For savory, I’ve seen mustards do well with meats.
